page.title: 16A DERELICT COTTAGE
page.content: In Lower Road, Layer Breton, on the edge of the farmyard of St. Catherine's Hall Farm, stands a very old cottage. This is the oldest cottage in Layer Breton. It was last lived in in the 1960's and since then has unfortunately fallen into a bad state of disrepair. During a storm the brick chimney stack fell through the roof and no repairs were made. Consequently the whole roof at the eastern end has collapsed. It is possible to see clearly the Tudor style oak framing and the wattle and daub which was used for filling. This was made of horse_hair, twigs, horse manure, cow dung and mud. The outside would have been white_washed. There is a preservation order on the building and hopefully it is soon to be restored to its original condition.
